entry.title: Stone Cold Lips
entry.summary:
Author: AluminiumBottleOfWater

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,621Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 189

Summary: In which Merlin is immortal, used all of his free time to do things because he'd go crazy otherwise and got filthy rich like an old vampire without meaning to, hung out with Shakespeare and a bunch of other people because why not, got gifted a pretty Cadillac that he hates by a charity he'd forgotten he'd donated to, and has a too-high alcohol tolerance for his liking. Oh, and he bought Avalon Lake. Because "Shut up, I just like looking at this lake and no, I don't need help." And a bunch of other mansions and estates and penthouses all over the country because "What if he wants to live somewhere else, I need to have OPTIONS."

entry.title: Camelot's best-kept secret
entry.summary:
Author: Orpheeeeus

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,029Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 22

Summary: Camelot's children knew one terrible secret: the king's manservant wasn't really human. Well… he wasn't human at all.Nobody but them was aware of it.They didn’t even think Merlin had noticed how different he was from everyone else.But it didn't matter. After all, children are very good at keeping secrets. Especially when those secrets involve petty crimes and magic tricks.

entry.title: If I told you myself
entry.summary:
Author: riverray

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 81,789Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 788

Summary: Merlin can’t remember the last time he’s locked his bedroom door, if ever. But he chooses not to think about it. He merely sulks his way back to his bed, taking a moment to contemplate taking off his trousers and tunic from the night before. He decides not to think about that either.Instead, he decides not to think at all. He just falls back into his bed, covers up his body more so in shame than for warmth, and closes his eyes. Basically Merlin is sexually assaulted and this story follows how he and everyone else deals with it.Spoiler alert: THEY DON'T HANDLE IT WELL.

entry.title: what nightmare tyrant hast for me
entry.summary:
Author: fictified

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,156Chapters: 1/20Kudos: 5

Summary: “The shifting of fates, Merlin. The death of that prince you serve. Surely you can feel it coming.” Merlin shook his head, less because he disagreed and more because he didn’t understand how the dragon could be so confidently wrong about the source of this problem. “Arthur’s been enchanted into love with the Lady Vivian,” he explained, “but that wasn’t Morgana. Or, I’m almost certain it wasn’t Morgana. Do you know of a way to break a love enchantment? He’s about to get himself killed.” “The witch must be dealt with, or she will be your doom.”   An alternate take on series 2 episode 10, and what that means for Destiny through series 3 episode 2 and beyond.

entry.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Time
entry.summary:
Author: HarmonyOfTheSpheres

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 50,214Chapters: 13/21Kudos: 457

Summary: Merlin has returned to Hogwarts for his second year as the History of Magic professor, and this time he is determined to find a way to destroy the horcrux within Harry before it's too late. It's not exactly a simple task, however, especially with an escaped convict on the loose and dementors lurking around Hogwarts' grounds. So when Merlin finally gets a chance to change Harry's fate, he takes it.A bit of time travel is surely worth the risk if it will save Harry's life—isn't it?

entry.title: There Were Dragons Here Once: One
entry.summary:
Author: Saxifactumterritum

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,137Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 3

Summary: Merlin comes to Longstead. He is a physician (sort of), a magician (not out loud), a wanderer. What brings him to that particular village at that particular time, is none of these things. He has a task to fulfill, and it's not his destiny. His destiny is not his business. He’s stretched out on a bank of grass, out beyond the village wall. Merlin is looking for plants that can be both magical and quiescent, he can make something innocuous seeming, betulia, belladonna. With the right spell, he can prolong the lives of the men and women laid out in village behind him. He will keep to himself just how close to the brink many of the villagers are. He can feel it, the edge of something encroaching, something ending, the smell of flesh.

entry.title: The Trial of Uther Pendragon
entry.summary:
Author: HerMajestyofLichtenstein

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 86,215Chapters: 53/?Kudos: 1,809

Summary: When Morgana invokes a long forgotten spell, the ancient and powerful Court of Magic is summoned to pass judgment on Uther Pendragon and his bloodline for their crimes against the magical world. But for the verdict to be carried out, every seat on the Council must be filled, and the chair of the Dragonlords has long stood empty. Now Merlin faces an impossible choice: side with his people and end Uther’s reign of terror, or save Arthur.

entry.title: Unarmoured
entry.summary:
Author: HowDidIGetHere20

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 180,768Chapters: 56/65Kudos: 270

Summary: Arthur has always taken Merlin on every mission — unarmoured, untrained, endlessly reckless. It never used to matter. But lately, every danger feels sharper. Every close call lasts too long. And Merlin is starting to notice the way Arthur hovers… and how the prince’s worry is beginning to look a lot like something else. A slow-burn story about devotion disguised as duty, love revealed through quiet choices, and the people who become home when the world turns dangerous. Love wins — even when it has to fight for it. Written with a companion playlist (linked in the notes) :)

entry.title: Draconis Majoris
entry.summary:
Author: Wilson

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,763Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 16

Summary: Merlin didn't remember the accident that had taken his memories; he didn't understand why Gaius had saved his life, or who he was running from, but he did know one thing-- avoid the Albionic court. So, naturally, his ship is immediately destroyed by Arthur, the despised son of the one man Merlin must avoid being noticed by at all costs. Fortunately for Merlin, he's not the only one with secrets. Or a past he'd rather not recall.

entry.title: The Ghost On The Shore
entry.summary:
Author: onceandfutureemrys

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,301Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Arthur has been dead for decades now, and Merlin drifts through years of solitude haunted by grief, loss, and the weight of his immortality. Custodian of Arthur’s legacy, he watches everything he once knew fade. Guided by some old friends, centuries pass. One day he discovers a familiar horn and in a desperate attempt to reach his other half, he blows it but is met with yet another failure. Waking up from fifteen centuries of rest, Arthur realizes that something has gone terribly wrong.In a land steeped in despair and shaped by fifteen centuries of enduring hope.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply
